summary: This is an email chain forwarding a letter from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan regarding the tentative order of defense witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The letter is submitted under temporary seal pending resolution of witness anonymity issues.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who submitted a letter to Judge Nathan regarding the tentative order of defense witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the document (U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell).

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email from Christian Everdell regarding the witness order letter.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Mentioned as having his chambers copied on the email regarding the witness order letter.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting legal correspondence on behalf of Maxwell's defense team regarding witness order.
Both are legal professionals involved in the Maxwell case, with Menninger copied on Everdell's correspondence.
Both are legal professionals involved in the Maxwell case, with Pagliuca's chambers copied on Everdell's correspondence.

events.title: Defense Submission of Witness Order Letter
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell submits a letter to Judge Nathan regarding the tentative order of defense witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: The defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell submitted a letter regarding the tentative order of defense witnesses on December 14, 2021.
The letter was submitted under temporary seal due to unresolved issues regarding witness anonymity.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and witness management in the Maxwell trial at that time.
The email shows communication between defense attorney Christian Everdell and Judge Nathan's chambers.
